fhir_comments:
The workflow/clinical status of this composition. 
The status is a marker for the clinical standing of the document.
Reference to the patient subject of the Composition
Reference to the clinical encounter or type of care this documentation is associated with.
The composition editing time, when the composition was last logically changed by the author.

Identifies who is responsible for the information in the composition, 
not necessarily who typed it in

resource.title: Adult Mental Health Service Discharge Summary

fhir_comments:
Identifies the organization responsible for ongoing maintenance of 
and access to the composition/document information.

The label for this particular section. This will be part of the rendered content for the document, 
and is often used to build a table of contents.
A SNOMED CT code identifying the kind of content contained within the section
A human-readable narrative that contains the attested content of the section
text.div:
Reason for admission Paranoid Schizophrenia
Admission method Accident and emergency or dental casualty department of the Health Care Provider
Legal status on admission Informal
Source of admission NHS other Hospital Provider - Ward for general Patients or the younger physically disabled or A and E department
Date/time of admission 12-Feb-2015 12:00

fhir_comments: Reference to the encounter resource where information for this section can be found

text.div: Causative agent No known allergy

Clinical Summary

Brought to the hospital A+E department by the police as had been involved in a disturbance in a shopping centre, assaulting another customer.

Agitated on interview and denying any thoughts of self-harm.

Denied any drug misuse.

Well known to local mental health services.
Treatments and interventions and changes made to treatments

Tested negative for banned substances following admission.

Diagnosis of Paranoid Schizophrenia, frequently uncompliant with treatment.

Due to poor adherence with treatment she was discharged from hospital subject to a Community Treatment Order and is, therefore, subject to recall to hospital if she does not adhere to treatment.
Diagnosis name Paranoid Schizophrenia

Discharging consultant

Prefix: Dr

Given Name: Mike

Family Name: Scott
Discharging specialty/department Adult mental illness - speciality
Discharge location

Name: Allerton ward

Identifier: RR8ALL
Date/time of discharge 05-Mar-2015 12:00
Legal status on discharge Formal CTO
Discharge method Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent
Discharge type Temporary place of residence when usually resident elsewhere (e.g. hotels, residential Educational Establishment)
Discharge address 27, Grove Street, Leeds, LS21 4GG

text.div: Individual requirements No special requirements, but states that her daughter should be contacted in an emergency.
Information and advice given Patient warned that she is subject to recall to hospital if she does not adhere to treatment.

Medication name Olanzapine 10mg tablets (Accord Healthcare Ltd)
Form Tablet
Route Oral
Dose directions description Take one 10 mg tablet daily.
Status Continued
Medication name Diazepam 2mg tablets (A A H Pharmaceuticals Ltd)
Form Tablet
Route Oral
Dose directions description Take three 2mg tablets daily for 7 days
Status Added

text.div:
Name

Prefix: Dr

Given Name: Mike

Family Name: Scott
Role Specialist Registrar
Specialty Adult mental illness - speciality
Date and time completed 05-Mar-2015 13:00
Contact details Phone: 0113 111225 (Work)
Organisation

Name: Leeds Mental Health Trust,

Address Line: Twenty One Fifty, Thorpe Park,

City: Leeds

Post Code: LS15 8ZB

Actions for healthcare professionals

Physical attention will be needed from Primary Care due to the fact she is an atypical antipsychotic and will need weight and general health monitoring

Person responsible: Dr Gillingham, Leeds Recovery and Support Team.

Status: Requested

Outcome and expectations: The patient is expected to benefit from physical attention from healthcare professionals and understands that she must attend her appointments.
Actions for patient or their carer Patient has agreed to commence the prescribed medication and expects this to improve her condition.
Agreed with patient or legitimate patient representative Patient has agreed to treatment plan and expects this to improve her mental and physical condition.
Care planning arrangements CPA Status and 117 Aftercare: Follow up will be made by the Leeds Recovery and Support team. 7 Day Follow up will be done by the community team.
Procedure name Drug of abuse screen

Risks to others Can be abusive and agitated when non compliant with treatment

Household composition Lives alone
Alcohol intake 50 units/week
Drug/substance use Frequently uncompliant with treatment and during these times often misuses alcohol and cannabis.
